sub_title: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science
summary:
Research and consulting experience in a broad range of ecological and environmental areas since 1995, including ecological impact assessment (also contra-expertise), nature management & restoration and (international) nature conservation.

My personal interests within the ecological management & conservation field are broad, in the range of countering climate change, ecological sustainability and rewilding, to research into mammalian carnivore ecology.

organizations.name: Active member of the Dutch Federation for International Nature Conservation Organisations (Globeguards)
organizations.position: Organisational member with the Rewilding Foundation

projects.title: Wolf (field) research and public education
projects.description:
Performing field research into the recovery and re-settlement of wolf populations in the Dutch-German border area and recently in the Netherlands (spontaneous rewilding with the wolf). Looking into landscape ecology and habitat choice/use, feeding ecology, behaviour and human-wolf relationships on the shifting 'wolf front' advocating proper and lawful measures against predation of livestock. 

Providing public education through a long range of seminars.

contributors.headline: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science

projects.title: Rewilding with reintroduction of the lynx on the British Isles
projects.description: As part of a community interest group and transdisciplinary team headed by Dr. Paul O'Donoghue of the University of Chester I provide expertise and facilitation in most of the relevant dimensions of this project. This includes large mammal restoration, rewilding, lynx sourcing from robust European populations, economic and branding analysis (with respect to ecotourism enhancement), environmental legislation, arranging partnerships, stakeholder consultation, education/PR, and managerial/organisational duties with respect to network building and maintenance.

projects.title: Visions of Nature
projects.description: A think-tank composed of academics from various disciplines (environmental philosophy, ecology/environmental science, social sciences, anthropology) meeting in monthly sessions to explore positions and views of nature, wildness and rewilding in the 21st Century with the wolf as rewilding herald and center piece. The initiative was chaired by Prof. dr. Martin Drenthen and held at Nijmegen (Radboud) University.

contributors.headline: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science
Assistant professor at Radboud University Nijmegen
Associate professor Environmental philosophy, Institute for Science in Society, Radboud University, Nijmegen.

projects.title: Conservation survey of the Asiatic black bear and Persian leopard in southern Iran
projects.description:
A conservation survey into the existence of large carnivores and (harmonizing) their relationship with shepherd communities in the province of Hormozgan in Southeastern Iran. This is a supportive collaboration with Arash Ghoddhousi and Taher Ghadirian of the Plan4theLand Society.

It resulted in the confirmation of a unique Asiatic black bear population in an arid environment with a cameratrap study. These animals usually live in subtropical to temperate forests of eastern Asia. It also revealed a growing human-wildlife conflict with the depredation of livestock and raiding of fig orchards by bears, probably driven by food shortage due to climate change.

Training in aspects of animal monitoring research was also provided to Iranian counterparts by the Rewilding Foundation.

contributors.headline: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science
Research Fellow at Humboldt-University Berlin
Member at IUCN/SSC Bear & Cat Specialist Group
Project Manager @ Bears in Mind

projects.title: Ecological sustainable development with rewilding of Vama Buzaului; a proud rural community in Transylvania
projects.description:
Flowing out from a previous succesful project (Safeguarding the Romanian Carpathians) I joined as hired consultant with the Dutch-Romanian Building the Future of Vama Buzaului entrepreneurial initiative to provide a prosperous future for the municipality of Vama Buzaului on the basis of ecological sustainable development. 

I provide integral ecological input and vision to aid in safeguarding the ecology of the region, establish facilities to protect the Ciucas Natura 2000 reserve and develop ecological and green business models; also to attain eco-certification for ecotourism and develop enhanceent of local (artisan) products. The integral approach for this - as a first investigation is currently published in a living document called an EcoChapter, as part of a Strategic or development plan for the municipality. 

I recently performed an ecological appraisal of the region and its close relationship with the future national park, a pre-feasibility study for the rewilding with European bison and developed green business models based on success-stories elsewhere.

At the same time I am developing a collaborative framework to effectuate a community interest group of dedicated experts (entrepreneurs, teachers & students from Romanian and foreign institutes, researchers, companies and other exemplary community sustainability organisations) working and learning together to achieve a unique demonstrative working model for ecological sustainability.

contributors.headline: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science

English-Romanian Conference Interpreter / Voice Over

projects.title: Development of ecological sustainable communities for rainforest biodiversity conservation in Bolivia; research & development studies
projects.description:
The Rewilding Foundation together with Dr. Nuno Negroes of Aveiro University and Dr. Ian Convery of Cumbria University are endeavouring the realisation of rainforest (indigenous) human and ecological community harmonisation in collaboration with the Bolivian NGO Asociación Boliviana para la Investigación y Conservación de Ecosistemas Andino Amazónicos (ACEAA). Currently with a funding application to the UK Darwin Initiative. 

Another project in Bolivia concerns a biodiversity survey of Tahuamanu Reserve and jaguar-human conflict resolution in the adjacent Manuripi Reserve in Pando, in collaboration with CIPA and Pando University.

contributors.headline: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science
RAISE Project Lead
Professor of Environment & Society @ University of Cumbria

projects.title: Research into and citizen science development for the conservation of small Mustelids in the Netherlands
projects.description:
Neglected in the current state of Dutch nature conservation the Small Mustelid Working Group is endeavouring to develop and mainstream (citizen science) research and monitoring for these inconspicuous small carnivores to get a handle on their conservation status. Probably highly indicative for environmental changes (including intensification of agriculture and habitat fragmentation) and other impact (e.g. the use of anticoagulant rodenticides) these animals are thought to decline. Hence this initiative to expose their plight to the scientific and public world. 

The field research is currently focussed on the application of the 'Mostela' a camera trap box able to photo capture individual weasels and stoats. The presence of small mustelids is related to habitat features or qualities and prey availability.

I am a co-founder of this group, active as field researcher, board member, author, public reader and as webmaster. 

I am also raising public attention to (fund study of the) ecotoxicological effects of second generation anticoagulatant rodenticides (SGARs) on small and other Mustelids in the Netherlands, proving indeed to be so as shown by studies elsewhere.

Animal ecologist interested in the coexistence of mammal communities and people. Citizen science and wildlife sensors.

projects.title: Research into the landscape ecology of pine marten populations in the east (IJssel River Valley) of the Netherlands
projects.description: Over the last decade pine martens have been spreading and increasing in number in forested areas of the central and eastern part of the Netherlands. This research is monitoring the recovery and the way pine martens utilise the landscapes in terms of habitat features and meta-population ecology. A novel method to record 'bib' patterns is used to distinguish and monitor the movements of individual animals.

contributors.headline: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science
Information Technology Security Engineer, CEH, CHFI, GIAC GMON, GPEN en GCLD.

projects.title: Ecological impact assessment of the building of an oil transfer station in a Ramsar protected (Kolkheti) wetland, in Georgia (Caucasus)
projects.description:
Assigned by the Ramsar Secretariat through Acta Consultants in Tblisi I investigated the ecological impacts of an illegally build oil transfer station in Anaklia marshes on the Georgian Black Sea coast as part of the protected Kolkheti Wetlands. This also included a compensation study. Partly performed as freelance ecologist and partly as employee of Waardenburg Consultants.

http://jpe.library.arizona.edu/volume_14/Gachechiladze.pdf

contributors.headline: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science

projects.title: Safeguarding the Romanian Carpathian Ecological Network
projects.description:
3-Year study funded by the Dutch government PIN-MATRA programme to train Romanian counterparts of the ICAS Forestry & Wildlife Institute in Brasov in allocating ecological network areas (corridors and cores).

The project involved:
A series of training workshops involving international consultants (Alterra, AIDEnvironment, U.S. Wildlands Network and the Australian University of Queensland), Romanian forestry & wildlife management officials and conservation NGO members (incl. Fundatia Carpati and Milvus).
Field surveys of corridor areas in connection with plans to build major highways across Transylvania, pointing to key sensitive areas for road ecological mitigation.
Landscape ecological (least-cost-path) modelling of key conservation areas for large mammalian carnivores (lynx, wolf and bear).
The production of a Vision Plan for safeguarding the Carpathian ecological network (see link), advising that a lot more area should be allocated to protect the important populations of large mammalian carnivores; at that time insufficiently protected by the allocated EU Natura 2000 system.

The project was successful with the designation of more than 1000 sq. kilometers extra land added to the Natura 2000-system in Romania.

The project and Vision Plan has been used and quoted in many other subsequent studies of the Carpathian ecology and has received much appreciation in Romanian conservation NGO circles.

contributors.headline: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science
Head of Project Management Unit at CIFOR-ICRAF - Center for International Forestry Research / World Agroforestry

projects.title: Building capacity for landscape and conservation ecology in Georgia (Caucasus); catalysing ecological network protection
projects.description: Assigned by the Georgian Center for the Conservation of Wildlife in Tblisi I was hired as consultant to aid in the institutional capacity building for nature conservation in Georgia. Specifically through a GEF funded project aimed at transferring knowledge for the protection of landscape & biological diversity, through a workshop and landscape survey (ecological corridor) field expedition with Georgian environmental authorities and NGOs. The workshop and proceedings were prepared in collaboration with Prof. dr. Michael Soule of the Wildlands Network.

contributors.headline: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science
Chief Technical Advisor (Team Leader) at GFA Consulting Group GmbH

projects.title: Investigation  into breeding success decline of a population of Hen Harrier on the Wadden Sea Islands
projects.description: Assigned by the Dutch Working Group on Birds of Prey (Raptors) and funded by Dutch Birdlife I performed an investigation into the most plausible factors causing the decline of breeding success of a remnant hen harrier population distributed over the Dutch Wadden Sea Islands. I looked integratively with modelling at relationships between environmental or habitat changes and breeding success. Information was gained through interviews with island ornithologists and reserve wardens.

contributors.headline: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science

projects.title: Modelling of biomagnification of xenobiotics in foodchains to set exotoxicological species protection standards
projects.description:
A study into the use of ecotoxicological modelling (compartimental; environmental and physiological) to arrive at a more integral and conceptual model for the setting of 'safe'​ environmental standards for animal species protection in the Netherlands. This project was assigned by the Dutch ecological quality standards authority at that time.

The model focussed on biomagnification of environmentally cumulative and persistent xenobiotics such as organochlorides (e.g. PCB's) and heavy metals such as cadmium in certain sensitive environments such as river floodplains. End-point species studied where shrews, raptors and otter.

contributors.headline: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science
Professor at Radboud University

projects.title: Molecular biology and endocrinology research into Insuline-like growth factor I & 2 gene expression
projects.description:
Postgraduate position at the CSIRO Division for Human Nutrition and the Department of Biochemistry (University of Adelaide) to complete my graduate research into the interesting findings of IGF-1 & 2 gene expression (mRNA splicing) in mice transgenic for growth hormone.

This revealed repeatedly a peculiar mRNA splicing mechanism in a mouse model with high expression of growth hormone. IGFs were under close study as protein hormones with the potential for wound healing and muscle regeneration enhancement, and as a key protein in human growth development.

contributors.headline: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science

projects.title: Research into the recovery of breeding populations and success of the Northern Goshawk and Sparrowhawk after the ban on persistent pesticides (DDT) in the Netherlands
projects.description:
My first project in scientific research.

Monitoring of the population development, breeding success and ecology of Goshawk (Accipiter gentiles) and Sparrowhawk (A. nisus) in a large forest area of the Utrechtse Heuvelrug in the period 1978 -1981. This was performed to analyse the recovery of raptor breeding populations after the ban on the persistent pesticide DDT and its residues (DDE) in the environment.

This involved intensive yearly inventory of raptor breeding territories, monitoring of breeding success (fledgling based) and of survival of parent or territorial birds using a novel molt feather ID system. Yearly results were reported and collated in scientific publications by Dr. Paul Opdam et al. of the Dutch Research Institute for Nature Management ( Rijksinstituut voor Natuurbeheer, RIN).

authors.headline: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science

company.name: EcoNatura - Research for nature, landscapes and people

profile_positions.company: EcoNatura - Research for nature, landscapes and people
profile_positions.description:
Provision of science-based and independent ecological consulting and research in the field of:

Ecological effect assessment, nature and environmental conservation, biodiversity, environmental legislation, advocacy for nature/conservation with evidence-based research, inventory of flora and fauna (incl. bat inventory), nature and landscape management planning, ecological surveys and sustainability or nature inclusive development (urban ecology that works).

Specialist areas: 
Conservation ecology (international experience), nature legislation, landscape ecology, animal ecology, biodiversity (most taxa covered), nature development and rewilding, ecological survey, ecotourism development.
profile_positions.title: EcoNatura - Consultant ecology and environmental science

profile_positions.description:
Research into the ecology of wolves in the modern landscapes of NW Europe. Through field research learning about various aspects of wolf (pack) behavior, feeding ecology, landscape ecology, throphic cascades and rewilding influence and about the relationship between wolves and people in the modern setting. Including the tailoring of best-practice wolf predation preventive measures on the basis of in-depth knowledge and other expert consultation of wolf ecology and behavior.

Gained first-hand and in-depth knowledge through field and broad literature study of wolves together with consultation of other wolf and field researchers. This is used to advance a sustainable relationship between wolves and people (people-wolf management) through seminars, interviews, consulting and authoring. 

Recently completed assignment on improving co-existence between wolves and people in the province of Friesland (Netherlands) as part of wolf plan - consultation and depredation prevention pilot study.

Currently author and co-editor of a new book on the wolf entitled 'The Wolf: Culture, Nature, Heritage' in collaboration with a wide array of experts to be published by Boydell & Brewer in the summer of 2023. (Co)authoring three chapters on the historical relationship of humans with wolves and the return of the wolf in Germany.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Ecological advisor and coordinator municipal biodiversity plan programme, advising internal and external clients on ecological policy, including operationalisation of the biodiversity plan and on matters regarding ecology and spatial planning and the application/assessment of environmental legislation in this domain. 

Working to promote and operationalise the Biodiversity plan with a wide range of stakeholders, including farming cooperations, protected area agencies, local nature initiatives and citizens.

Actions from the biodiversity plan include the development of a citizen science project en creating support for grassroots biodiversity initiatives.
profile_positions.title: Landscape ecologist biodiversity advisor

profile_positions.description:
Co-founder and researcher promoting (international) conservation research on Small Mustelids.

Research, field work, organising and presenting workshops on Small Mustelid research, (website) authoring, participation in international conferences and collaborative projects.
profile_positions.title: Onderzoeker beschermingsecologie Kleine Marters (Researcher Mustelid ecology & conservation)

profile_positions.description:
Endeavouring international conservation projects aimed at promoting and effectuating the vision of (science-based) rewilding. Research (rewilding, reintroduction and research on wolf population recovery in cultural landscapes), provision of international seminars and authoring.

Co-founder of the Rewilding Taskforce under the IUCN Commission for Ecosystem Management, in consortium with the University of Cumbria and the Wildland Research Institute/University of Leeds.

Provision of public seminars and authoring on rewilding and side-subjects, such as the spontaneous rewilding of modern European cultural landscapes with the wolf and harmonisation with human interests.
profile_positions.title: Researcher and advocate for rewilding with the role of Chairman of the foundation

profile_positions.description: Consulting assignments in various areas of ecology & environment
profile_positions.title: Ecologisch adviseur/Ecological consultant

profile_positions.description: Ecological consulting with various assignments, including ecological impact-assessment, field inventory flora & fauna, landscape and road ecological design and international nature conservation projects.
profile_positions.title: Ecologisch adviseur/Ecological and environmental consultant

profile_positions.description: In between environmental consultant positions I undertook the task of advisor on environmental matters to the public in an environmental documentation centre.
profile_positions.title: Consultant environmental information

profile_positions.description: Working for a year abroad in Georgia (Caucasus) as ecological consultant with the mission to develop a Biodiversity expertise centre for the Black Sea, an EU funded project. Majority of work involved training staff to become environmental experts and provide international exposure (institutional capacity building). Also performed biodiversity studies in parts of Georgia in collaboration with Georgian NGO's.
profile_positions.title: Consultant biodiversity conservation Black Sea Environmental Programme (BSEP)

volunteer_experiences.description: Various projects including co-founding of the Small Mustelid Working group, co-organisation of a workshop on wild boar management, articles on mustelid research and the organisation of a workshop on camera trapping.

Volunteer capacity aiding Wetlands International in their new settlement in Wageningen in the Netherlands, including the development of a PIN-MATRA funded WI project for the conservation of wetland birds in the limans of the Sea of Azov, Ukraine.
